top_comment.text:
The pirates of the carribean joke was funny, but it doesn't make sense. 
They would have to be a movie every 25 days starting from 2003 in order to 
have 700 movies. Plus, that's not even counting how we lost a lot of time 
considering by 2017 there will only be 5 movies, so in order to make 701 
(they said over 700) minus the 5 we will have by 2017, we would have to 
make 35*12*30 (approximate days till 2052 from 2017) /694 (movies we will 
still need to make by 2052) = approximately one movie every 18 days. Now 
explain how that is possible﻿
top_comment.author: X Long

comments.text:
What if they were using time travel for the movies? Film it, send a copy 
back to yourself, then fund the filming with the box office money. The more 
it makes, the better funded it is (meaning better quality, actors, and 
effects), leading to increased sales... It's a wonderful paradox for the 
movie companies. As for the Iphones, many times there are "Version 1, 
version 1.1, etc, but they will skip, so instead of versions 2, 3, and 4, 
it will go from 3 to 10 just because it sounds better, or like the company 
put a lot more work into it. Instead of the Iphone 573, they may have just 
skipped from 400 to 500, and so on, meaning that there were, in fact, far 
fewer Iphone models than 6057.

comments.author: The Lord Char

comments.text:
I just have to say this is stupid. The fact that people are coming to 
youtube to tell the world that they are fighting technology because those 
who use it are foolish and not tan is just worrying.

Oh, and news flash: Skin cancer is real, and it can kill. Tan doesn't mean 
anything. If you're trying to impress people with your health, show us some 
stats for your most recent 5k, half, or full marathon, recent sports game 
scores, medals for winning state swim meets, some track records, or a 
picture of you summiting a mountain. Anybody can sit in the sun and get a 
tan, or even get artificial ones. It takes time and effort to actually 
accomplish things.

If you're generalizing an entire continent (Technically America is 2 
continents...) based on a class that sounds a bit like a bunch of 6th 
graders... well. That's kinda stupid. I'm assuming you mean the USA. There 
are people in South and central America who don't even have access to clean 
water, electricity, or basic education. I doubt they are worrying about 
minecraft.

If you want to fix stuff, first learn not to make generalizations, that 
"America" is not a country, it's a continent or two, third, that being tan 
means nothing and that you should wear sunscreen, and finally, that if you 
want to make a difference, the youtube comments on a sketch comedy group is 
not the best place to start rallies to save the world from something you 
never clearly define.

Have a nice day!
comments.author: TPGFan

captions.text: BUT THEY DID FIND THE AXE.
AND PEOPLE SAY YOU CAN STILL HEAR THE DEAD WOODSMAN'S HAUNTED
THAT'S THE LAMEST GHOST STORY EVER!
THAT STORY USED TO SCARE ME SILLY WHEN I WAS YOUR KIDS' AGE.
AN AXE MURDERING WOODSMAN IS THE KIND OF STUFF WE
>>SO THAT'S WHY I SAW ELMO STICKING OSCAR THE GROUCH
UM, HAVE I EVER TOLD YOU KIDS THE STORY OF MY OLD I-PHONE?
NOW, LONG BEFORE THE I-PHONE 6,057S THERE WAS THE IPHONE 5S.
IT WEIGHED NEARLY FOUR OUNCES AND WAS A CENTIMETER THICK.
NOW AS LONG AS YOU DON'T SHOW IT FEAR,
HOW COULD YOU LIFT SOMETHING THIS HEAVY?
WAS NO MORE THAN FOUR AND IN A PLACE LIKE THIS,
HECK, YOU'D BE LUCKY TO GET THREE.
>>DEPENDS, I REMEMBER THERE WAS THIS NIGHT,
IT TOOK ME A FULL MINUTE JUST TO DOWNLOAD A MOVIE.
NOTHING HAS EVER TAKEN THAT LONG TO DOWNLOAD.
GRANDPA'S JUST TRYING TO SCARE US.
I REMEMBER THERE WAS A TIME BEFORE WE EVEN INSTANTLY
>NO, I KNOW WHAT HE'S TALKING ABOUT.
WE LEARNED ABOUT IT IN MY ANCIENT HISTORY CLASS.
IT WAS THIS WEIRD LOOKING VIDEO VENDING MACHINE
>>THERE'S NO SUCH THING AS A "RED BOX."
THERE'S NO SUCH THING AS A "RED BOX."
"RED BOX"AIN'T NOTHING TO BE SCARED OF.
NOW, BLOCKBUSTER VIDEO ON THE OTHER HAND...
HAVE I EVER TELL YOU KIDS THE STORY OF THE LATE FEE OF 2003?
>>I WANT TO CALL MY MOM, BUT MY PHONE BLEW AWAY!
>>I REMEMBER IT LIKE IT WAS YESTERDAY.
THE MOVIE PIRATES OF THE CARIBBEAN HAD JUST
BACK WHEN JOHNNY DEPP STILL CARED ABOUT HIS CAREER.
>>GUESS HOW I GOT TO  BLOCKBUSTER THAT DAY.
>>[SCREAMS] AND IT TOOK ME FIVE WHOLE
>>HOW WERE YOU STILL INTERESTED IN SOMETHING AFTER FIVE
WHEN I GOT TO THE VIDEO STORE AN AWKWARD TEENAGED VIDEO
AND HE SPOKE WORDS TO ME WITH HIS OWN MOUTH!
AND DO YOU KNOW WHAT HE SAID WHEN I ASKED ABOUT THE VIDEO?
>>HE SAID, "SORRY SIR, WE'RE ALL CHECKED OUT!"
LIKE YOU HAD TO WAIT 20 SECONDS AND THEN--
I HAVEN'T EVEN TOLD YOU WHAT A VHS IS!

title: Scary True Story from the Future - Studio C
